page.title: 11FARMING THE FLATLANDS
page.content: The{flatlands}in the centre of our area are used mainly for{arable {farming,}the largest unit being at {Howton Court.}The soil is mostly heavy clay, but with the use of modern, sophisticated machinery and the careful application of{fertilizers}and sprays, good crops can be harvested. A four year{crop rotation}system is normally used: oil seed rape, wheat for milling, wheat for animal feed, and barley. Some smaller fields have had the dividing hedges removed to create larger units of 25-30 acres which are more suited to the large modern tractors and ploughs. Two men can now do the work that required at least ten employees thirty years ago.The straw is sold standing to local stockfarmers and the stubble is ploughed back into the land.
